harlow.utils.distance#

Fast and numba compatible scipy.distance like functions. Inspired by and based on: https://github.com/talboger/fastdist

Module Contents#

Functions#

euclidean_distance(→ float)

Euclidean distance between two vectors.

fractional_distance(→ float)

Fractional distance between two vectors.

pdist_condensed(→ numpy.ndarray)

Pairwise Euclidean distances between n-dimensional vectors. Similar to

pdist_full_matrix(→ numpy.ndarray)

Pairwise Euclidean distances between n-dimensional vectors. Similar to

fractional_pdist_full_matrix(→ numpy.ndarray)

Pairwise Euclidean distances between n-dimensional vectors. Similar to

harlow.utils.distance.euclidean_distance(u_vec: numpy.ndarray, v_vec: numpy.ndarray) → float[source]#

Euclidean distance between two vectors.

harlow.utils.distance.fractional_distance(u_vec: numpy.ndarray, v_vec: numpy.ndarray) → float[source]#

Fractional distance between two vectors.

harlow.utils.distance.pdist_condensed(x_mx: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]#

Pairwise Euclidean distances between n-dimensional vectors. Similar to scipy.spatial.distance.pdist but faster for a large number of vectors.

TODO: maybe it could be faster if there was just one loop, kk -> ii, jj.

Parameters

x_mx – An m by n matrix of m vectors in an n-dimensional space.

Returns

Condensed distance matrix.

harlow.utils.distance.pdist_full_matrix(x_mx: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]#

Pairwise Euclidean distances between n-dimensional vectors. Similar to scipy.spatial.distance.pdist and scipy.spatial.distance.squareform but faster for a large number of vectors.

Parameters

x_mx – An m by n matrix of m vectors in an n-dimensional space.

Returns

A full (m by m) distance matrix.

harlow.utils.distance.fractional_pdist_full_matrix(x_mx: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]#

Pairwise Euclidean distances between n-dimensional vectors. Similar to scipy.spatial.distance.pdist and scipy.spatial.distance.squareform but faster for a large number of vectors.

Parameters

x_mx – An m by n matrix of m vectors in an n-dimensional space.

Returns

A full (m by m) distance matrix.
